New Records: England went 1-0 down in three consecutive Wembley games for the first time since November 1954.
Key Match Events: Jon Dagur Thorsteinsson scored the only goal of the match for Iceland.
Harry Kane missed a fine opportunity to equalize from Cole Palmer’s delivery.
Cole Palmer went close to drawing England level after the break.
John Stones was injured and did not come out for the second half.
Pre-Game Insights: Gareth Southgate’s starting lineup for the opening group game against Serbia seems written in stone, except for one position — the third midfield spot.
The two main contenders to partner Declan Rice in the deeper lying roles seem to be Conor Gallagher and Kobbie Mainoo.
Post-Match Reflections: Gareth Southgate acknowledged the performance wasn't good enough and emphasized the need to improve both with and without the ball.
Southgate mentioned that the game was a good focus ahead of the tournament and highlighted the importance of being better without the ball.
Miscellaneous Highlights: England's defensive issues were highlighted, particularly the lack of intensity in pressing and the disjointed nature of their play.
Concerns were raised about England's defense, especially with the absence of Harry Maguire and Jarrad Branthwaite.
England's attacking talent was noted, but the performance did not justify their status as one of the favorites to win Euro 2024.
